meanings.definition: The process of forming or creating polymers.
meanings.sent1: Polymerism involves combining small molecules to create long chains.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study polymerism to understand how different materials are made.
meanings.sent3: At the polymerism workshop, they joked that mixing ingredients felt like magic.
meanings.sent4: The growth of ideas in a brainstorming session can be compared to the polymerism of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of polymerism lies in the intricate connections between molecules.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being a polymer.
meanings.sent1: The strength of the plastic was due to its polymerism.
meanings.sent2: Polymerism can affect the flexibility and durability of a material.
meanings.sent3: The polymerism of the toy made it stretchy and fun to play with.
meanings.sent4: The polymerism of the fabric gave it a unique texture and appearance.
meanings.sent5: The polymerism of the paint allowed it to adhere smoothly to the surface.
